turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: But suppose you find nothing but a wasteland. How will you survive?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: He won't survive.  Do you know what sort of life awaits you out there, Taylor? That of an animal. If you aren't eventually hunted down and killed by apes, some jungle beast will devour you.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: But the proof? The doll?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: In a few minutes there will be no doll. There can't be.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Bunker...

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: ...but 'Lias is still out there.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I'll get him. You get the man in, Taylor  NOW. Or I'll Article 15 both your asses. Move!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Elias is dead. Join up with the platoon. Move it.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: He's dead! Where?... You saw him?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Yeah. Back about 100 metres. He's dead, now get going, the gooks are all over the fuckin' place.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I SHIT on all o' you.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: KILL YOU MOTHERFUCKER!!!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Elias - you take your squad and I'll take Tex and Francis from your squad.  We move out in two-zero mikes.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: I thought it was O'Neill's turn tonight.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Blood trail just keeps going and going but no body.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: How the hell did he get away?

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Fuckers returned fire soon as we lit 'em up. Hard core fuckin' NVA. They got their shit together.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: WHAT THE FUCK YOU DOING!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Stay out of this Elias. This ain't your show.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: YOU AIN'T A FIRING SQUAD, YOU PIECE OF SHIT!!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: You're dead, you're fucking dead Elias!

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: YOU - you're going to fuckin' jail, buddy, you ain't getting away with this one!!!!!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Where the fuck is red platoon! Tell 'em to get their asses up here! What the fuck you doin' back here Elias? Round up your assholes and move 'em up front, we're getting chopped to shit.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Barnes, listen to me... there's 5-6 spiderholes back there  next to the church.  Third Platoon's coming up the stream to reinforce us. Flank's wide open, dinks get 3-4 snipers in these holes, when Third Platoon comes up, they'll get us in a crossfire with 'em. We'll shoot each other to shit, then they'll hit us with everything they got. It'll be a massacre!

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: ...You keep pouring out that suppressing fire, Barnes. I don't wanna be caught out there with my ass hanging out you hear me?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Don't tell me how to fight this fucking war, 'Lias, you go crying to fucking brigade on your time. Out here you belong to me. Now move.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: We got boo-coo movement. 3rd Battalion just got hit 15 kliks north of here.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Yeah, they had claymores strung up in the trees, blew a whole fucking platoon to pieces. BAAD SHIT.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: So what's the problem?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Says he can't walk.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Shit. Get your boots on Martin, next time I catch you putting mosquito repellent on your fuckin' feet I'm gonna courtmartial your nigger ass.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Sarge?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Yeah that long hairy orange and black bastard I found in the ammo crate. I'm gonna put it in this asshole's crotch, see if he can walk.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Uh... Bob. Like to speak to you. Take a minute.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Yeah, what is it?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Bob, I got Elias' R&R... It's coming up in 3 days. Going to Hawaii. See Patsy.  I never asked you for a break, I was hoping you... you'd send me in on the chopper with King... what do you say Chief?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I can't do that for you, Red... We need every swinging dick in the field. Sorry bout that...

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Hey Bob, come on! Talk to me hunh, it's your friend Red, I'm only asking you for three days chief...

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I'm talking to you Red and I'm telling you no. Get back to your position.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Bob, I gotta bad feeling about this, I... I'm telling you I got a bad feeling, man, I don't think I'm gonna make it... y'know what I mean?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: ...everybody gotta die sometime Red... Get back to your foxhole.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Hey Big Harold, gimme your peaches for the fruitcake man.

turns.speaker: BIG HAROLD
turns.text: Fuck you bitch.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: C'mon man, didn't I do you right that time I give you the turkey loaf for the ham and lima beans shit.

turns.speaker: BIG HAROLD
turns.text: Tricky bitch, reason you gimme dat turkey loaf is nobody else can eat that shit 'cept me so don't start your game playing with me Junior.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Youse a pig man. I hope Manny get dat laundry gig for' you do.

turns.speaker: BIG HAROLD
turns.text: De fool think he's gonna get it but he ain't known for his thinking.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: He's a fool alright but you a bigger fool. Hey, whiteboy, watcha waiting for - dat hole ain't gonna dig itself...

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Hey Taylor, you don't know it but I saved your ass today. I killed a shit-eating dog.

turns.speaker: BIG HAROLD
turns.text: That reminds me, I gotta take a shit.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: You gonna wipe your ass dis time?

turns.speaker: BIG HAROLD
turns.text: Yeah if you let me have your shirt.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Don babytalk him man. Cocksucker fell asleep. They walked right up on us, he don do shit.

turns.speaker: BIG HAROLD
turns.text: Shaddup bitch.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Listen to that shit, that's good shit!

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Fuck that redneck noise, dude. All dem chicks be rappin' how dey losin' der' ho's and how dey ain't got no bread for beer. Fuck dat honky shit. Got to get me some motown jams, dig it?

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Whaddaya talking shit for man. Hey Junior! Y'ever smoke any shit?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Das right dude. You be tryin' to string de black man out on dat shit and keep him DOWN. Time's be coming, my man, when de black man's gonna throw off that yoke.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Say I can dig it. Smoke that shit everything kinda gets weird y'know?  Y'hear that story the gooks is putting chemicals in the grass so's we become 'pacifists' so's we don fight  Where the hell's everybody, they'se gettin high that's what - bunch of hopheads, they think they special...

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Don you worry Bunny, youse a killer anyway.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Yeah but I still like a piece of pussy once in a while - ain't nothing like a piece of pussy cept maybe the Indie 500.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Youse so fucked up man.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Y'ever look at yoself in the mirror Junior, youse uglier than a dick on a dog man.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Yeah, you had a piece of pussy on a plate in front of you, you'd probably kill it.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Shit, I bet I been laid more'n you have.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Sure, you probably stick it in tween her knees and think youse there.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Only way you'd get some pussy is your bitch dies and wills it to you - and then maybe.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Come on you can do better than that!

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Fuck this shit! I ain't dyin' in no white man's war! Ise didi-ing this motherfuckah!

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: You lame Taylor?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: You lame or something?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Where's he from?

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Barnes comes from Hell.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Does he have a metal plate in his head?

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: You mean he's crazy? No more crazy'n the rest of us been out in the bush too long.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Baaa, got no time to go to the movies. Love and Hate too busy fighting for possession of my soul.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Where's Elias come from?

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: 'Lias come naturally.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Taylor - get your ass over here. Move!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Hang tough, Gator. Hang in there, man, you're gonna be OK... just hang on.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Yeah! I got two of them fuckers...

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: I got one...

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: ...See them go down? Like fuckin' target practice man, fuck you Charlie!! Ho Chi Minh sucks dead dick!... Crawford!

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Shit boy you been out in the sun too long. You try that, he'll stick it right back up your ass with a candle on it.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Then what do you suggest big shot?

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: I suggest you watch your own asses cause Barnes gonna be down on ALL OF 'EM.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Fuck this shit!

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: You guys trying to cure the headache by cutting off the head. 'Lias didn't ask you to fight his battles and if there's a Heaven - and god, I hope so - I know he's sitting up there drunk as a fuckin' monkey and smokin' shit cause HIS PAINS HE DONE LEFT DOWN HERE. Baaaaaaaaa!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You're wrong man! Any way you cut it Rhah, Barnes is a murderer.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I was wrong.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Wrong? You ain't EVER been right - 'bout nothing. And dig this you assholes and dig it good! Barnes been shot 7 times and he ain't dead, that tell you something? Barnes ain't meant to die. Only thing can get Barnes... is Barnes!

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Taylor! Francis!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Over here!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Rhah! What's going on. Rodriguez's hole just got...

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Okay, here it is - one, we got gooks in the fuckin' perimeter.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: La Dai! La Dai! GET THE FUCK OUTTA THERE!

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Hey take it easy man. They're scared.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: They're scared? What about me! I'm sick of this shit man, I'm sick of this shit! They don't want us here! Who do you think they're fighting for! GET OUTTA THERE!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Where's Lerner?

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Out there man - behind the log.

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Come on man!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Hey Taylor, you okay man?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Yeah. How 'bout you?

turns.speaker: FRANCIS
turns.text: Jes' fine man, jes fine! Ain't never felt better! Both of us two timers man, we're out.  See you at the hospital man, we gonna get high-high yessir...

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: First time?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Then the worm has definately turned for you man.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Feel good?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Yeah. No pain in my neck now. Feels good.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Feelin' good's good enough.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: ...But what'd she do?

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: What didn't she do. She fucked the living shit outta me, that's what she did!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: But what'd she actually do?

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: She was a crossbreed, Chinese and Polish.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Dawn! That was it!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Dawn...

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: ...I can't sleep, why don't you get some sack time.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: ...don't feel like it either.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: ...beautiful night.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Yeah. I love this place at night. The stars... there's no right or wrong in them, they're just there.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: That's a nice way of putting it.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Barnes got it in for you, don't he?

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Barnes believes in what he's doing.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: And you, do you believe?

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: In '65 - yeah. Now...  No. What happened today's just the beginning. We're gonna lose this war...

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You really think so... us?

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Oh shit! Sometimes there's things in my head... man. Grass does that to me, fucks me all up like a crazy Indian...

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Do you believe that stuff about... knowing you're gonna die?

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Yeah, those are the guys that live. I really don't think Death gives a shit, it's like a giant garbage can, I think it takes whatever it can get... you never know where it's gonna come from anyway... so why spin your wheels?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I'll go with you.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: No... I move faster alone.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Okay - got light duty, three days.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Shit, too bad we in base camp anyway.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What you got there - beers?

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Yeah, just stole me some from the Top's supply but he's stealing it from us anyway.  Chucks are coming. You better 'didi' man.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: How the fuck you get over here man, you look like you educated...

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I volunteered.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: You WHAT? Say 'gain.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Yeah, I dropped out of college and told 'em I wanted infantry, combat, and Nam...

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: You okay man? Neck botherin' you?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Nah...

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Here have some of this. Won't feel a thing.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: No, thanks...

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Go on, whatcha gotta lose, yo' here now...

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: ...you know that night we got hit... I...

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Fuck it, don't mean nothing, no such thing here as a coward, done your best man, next time y'do better.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Yo getting there Taylor. You be cool now and I'll introduce you 'round to some of the 'heads'.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What are the heads?

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Later...

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Three years, Jesus, he's crazy as Barnes...

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Well sometimes a man jes don' wanna go back. How you gonna talk to civilians man? People back in the world just don't give a shit, y'know what I mean, to them you're a fuckin' animal is all -

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Must be somebody?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: ...there's nobody.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: You been smoking too much shit babe. Gotta control that. Takes a man down... I remember when you first come out to the bush, you was straight as a...

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Who gives a shit!

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: 'People say I'm the life of the party cause I tell a joke or two although I may be laughing loud and hardy deep inside I'm blue...'

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Y'ever get caught in a mistake King and you just can't get out of it?

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Way out of anything, man. Just keep your pecker up, your powder dry, the worm WILL turn. How many days you short?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Not just me... it's the way the whole thing works. People like Elias get wasted and people like Barnes just go on making up rules any way they want and what do we do, we just sit around in the middle and suck on it! We just don't add up to dry shit.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Does a chicken have lips? Whoever said we did, babe. Make it outta here, it's all gravy, every day of the rest of your life man - gravy. Oh shit, superlifer!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Hey that's great King, that's great... you take it on home for me, you tell 'em King... got your address right? You know where you can reach men, man. Anytime!

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: I gotta didi man. Don't wanna miss that chopper. I'll send you a postcard. After I get me some. I'll send you some tapes too man. This new guy Jimi Hendrix man, whew... you okay Taylor? Just 'member take it easy now, don't think too much, don't be a fool, no such thing as a coward cause it don't mean nuthin. Jes keep on keepin' on. Okay my man...

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: ...Motherfuckah, motherfuckah, I'm too short to be dealing with this shit! They keep fucking with us man, no letup...

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Politics man, fuckin' politics. That O'Neill man got his nose so far up Top's ass he gotta be Pinocchio...

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Forty-two days man and a wakeup and I'm a gone motherfucker. Back to de WORLD.

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Broke a 100. Got 92 to go. April 17. DEROS man. California this summer. Waves are good they tell me, surfin's gonna be good...

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: March man in Tennessee, sniff the pines... sniff that crossmounted pussy walkin' down by the river. What you got Taylor?  Let's see three hundred and WHAT?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: You volunteered for this shit man?

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: You a crazy fucker, givin' up college man.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: What we got here a crusader?

turns.speaker: CRAWFORD
turns.text: Sounds like it.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Shit! Morehouse and Sal are short. Fu Sheng's going on R&R, you don't want to send their asses out on an ambush. You got the fresh meat Elias.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: They don't know shit Barnes, and chances are we gonna run into something.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: So what am I going to do! Get one of my guys zapped so some fuckface fresh from the World can get his beauty fucking sleep!

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Hey O'Neill why don't you cool it, you don't have to be a prick everyday of your life, you know.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Fuck you Elias.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Excuses are like assholes, Taylor - everybody got one.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Knock it off! We got two men need attention here. Police up your extra ammo and frags, don't leave nothing for the dinks. Hoyt, Junior, carry Gardner.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Tell Six we need engineers here, this pos. is crawling with traps.

turns.speaker: WOLFE
turns.text: They're on their way...  There's a gook village half a klik downriver, Battalion wants us to move in and search it ASAP, something's going on... where's Barnes?

turns.speaker: WOLFE
turns.text: Alright, Six says torch this place! Blow the weapons in place. Round up all suspected Vee Cees and shake it up! We ain't got much light left.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Why the fuck didn't you do something Lieutenant!

turns.speaker: WOLFE
turns.text: What are you talking about!

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: You know what I'm talking about!

turns.speaker: WOLFE
turns.text: No I don't. I don't know what the fuck you're talking about, Elias!

turns.speaker: WOLFE
turns.text: Sounds pretty far out to me 'Lias.

turns.speaker: ELIAS
turns.text: Maybe but I seen it happen at Ia Drang in '66, First Cavalry and they cut us to fuckin' pieces!  Give me three men, if I'm wrong, I can still roll up that flank.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Whatcha doing in the underworld Taylor?

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: This ain't Taylor. Taylor been shot. This man Chris been resurrected...

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Merle?

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Merle? Jesus!... Patty?

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Whew! - where that come from?

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Found it. Growing in a garden.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Sheeit, beats burning hutches anyway...

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: I know Barnes six months and I'll tell ya something - that man is MEAN, red in his soul like a dick on a dog.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Barnes gets killed, his jaws'd go on clacking...

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: He done a year in Japan in the hospital, then when he gets out, the first thing he done is re-up. Four years he been in the field...

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: ...and you know how many times he done been shot?  Seven times!  Seven.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: The Good Lord works his revenge in strange ways.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Yeah, you done said it. Revenge on US.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Not the only man to meet his Jezebel either.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: So he got a reduced and come over here. Nam's his freedom man, Nam's his pussy. Three years he been here.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Then you jes gonna forget 'bout Elias and all the good times we done had? Right in here.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: He dugged his own grave.

turns.speaker: KING
turns.text: Right on.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: I remember first time you came in here Taylor you telling me how much you admired that bastard.

turns.speaker: LERNER
turns.text: And Baaaaaaa! back on you.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: If you're gonna do it man, 'least do it right.

turns.speaker: LERNER
turns.text: I didn't like it.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Bah, you're a child, Lerner. Rhah don't waste time on you.

turns.speaker: LERNER
turns.text: Tennessee someplace. Hill country.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Barnes took a bullet right there. At Ia Drang Valley...  And the cocksucker SURVIVED - that's BAAAD man. That's his high, baby. High on WAR!

turns.speaker: LERNER
turns.text: Well he ain't normal that's fo sure.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: That's what he is... Baaaa!

turns.speaker: LERNER
turns.text: I was home on leave y'know and everybody's just worried 'bout making money, everybody's out for themselves, they don't even want to talk about it man, it's like the fucking Twilight Zone back there - you wouldn't even KNOW there's a war on here. My sister says to me why you have to go there like I started this...

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Baaaa! Fuck it, they sold us out - so what! What'd you'all expect? Civilian life is phoney BULLSHIT man. They're ROBOTS man - watchin' dopey television and drivin' dopey cars, and they fuck up, nobody dies. That's all right, you keep fuckin' up, politicians keep lyin'. Cause it don't really matter. Don't mean shit. So what! Whatcha want - a parade! Fuck that too! No war time no grunt never got no respect. Till he was dead - and even THEN! You're fighting for YOURSELF man! You're fighting for your SOUL, dat's all. Remember dat. And it's some goddamn battle too - if you'se a man, wrestle with that angel...  ...Love and Hate - the whole shitbang show, that's the story then and now and it ain't hardly gonna change...

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: You wanted to see me sir?

turns.speaker: WOLFE
turns.text: Jackson, looks like you got Elias' squad now.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Squad? I didn't know we was still referring to this platoon in terms of squads sir.

turns.speaker: WOLFE
turns.text: These two holes are yours...

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Begging your pardon Lieutenant but my holes are far enuff apart you could run a regiment through there and nobody'd see them - I got five live bodies left...

turns.speaker: WOLFE
turns.text: I don't want to hear your problems, Jackson. You'll get new men any day. Time being you make do like everybody else.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Hey Lieutenant I didn't ask for this job, I...

turns.speaker: WOLFE
turns.text: I don't want to hear about it Jackson.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: You don't want to hear about it?

turns.speaker: WOLFE
turns.text: That's right. I don't want to hear about it 'cause to tell you the truth, I don't give a shit okay... I just don't give a shit anymore.

turns.speaker: RHAH
turns.text: Right...

turns.speaker: WOLFE
turns.text: This is one time we could sure use Elias.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No thanks, I've seen Seattle.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: My name's Larry Mitchell. I live in Vancouver.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Same as an hour ago. Remember? I'm the steady type.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm afraid there's nothing I can do about it, Mr. Mitchell.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: You could tell me your name. And where you're going.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: How far does this train go?

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Vancouver, B.C.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm going to Vancouver, Mr. Mitchell.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Or Reno?  They always throw them off the bridge there, I've heard.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Perhaps I don't take it so lightly.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Where are you staying in Vancouver Royal. It's pretty crowded you know.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Is it? I expected to go to the Vancouver Royal. Should I have a reservation?

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: I'll make one for you.  I live there.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Well..

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: A very small service. It doesn't even ask for thanks. How long for?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I really don't know.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Indefinitely?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: You don't know.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Nice room. Balcony and everything. Lovely view too.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Very nice Mitchell turns.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: No thanks?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Suppose I hadn't known that immigration inspector? Hadn't put in a good word for you?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm supposing.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: I think you're a nice girl. I like you. But I can read signs if the print is large enough. It was your manner more than the wedding ring that bothered the inspector.  A sort of tenseness, as if you were afraid of something.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: I have a darned good idea you're name isn't Betty Mayfield at all.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: How about taking to Uncle Larry into the old firm? He's a useful guy to have on your side.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Don't get me wrong, Betty. I'm not suggesting you murdered anybody, you know.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Dine and dance tonight? I've got fifty bucks to throw away.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Not tonight.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm not in the mood for dining and dancing.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: We have some nice places around Vancouver.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm sure you have.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Well, how about a breeze up to the penthouse about six o'clock?  A friend of mine is throwing a cocktail party up there.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I haven't been invited.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Nobody gets invited to Clark Brandon's parties. They just go.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Perhaps I'd better get you straightened out, Mr. Mitchell. You've been rather nice to me, in a couple of ways. And I'm grateful. But I don't think this entitles you to put me on a leash.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Nobody I'd rather have on a leash.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: The brush-off, huh?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm trying very hard to be polite about it.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Don't I even get my face slapped?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Would you mind?

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Okay. You win.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: If you change your mind about the cocktail party, or anything else, give me a buzz.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: If I change my mind.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Betty, this is Margo West. She wants to meet you. Miss Mayfield.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: How do you do?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I think I'd like to dance.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Why certainly, baby.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Please be a little more careful how you talk, Mr. Mitchell.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: How careful should I be?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't like being referred to as babe, or addressed as baby. I don't like your possessive attitude, nor your hints of secret knowledge. In fact, to be very frank, Mr. Mitchell, I don't think I like you.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Maybe you're going to have to like me.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I think you're drunk.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Just drunk enough.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: What's the matter, baby? Don't you like being kissed?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Next time you try that, Mr. Mitchell...  ..don't. I'm warning you.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Good evening, Miss.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: How soon can I get a plane to Seattle?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: I'm afraid there's nothing more tonight, Miss. Unless you charter a plane.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: How long would that take?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Well... they have to service the plane... and get a pilot down to the field, unless there's one hanging around there still... and then they have to get the immigration officer...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Immigration Officer?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Crossing the border this time of night they're a bit particular. You'd have to prove your identity, you know... unless you've got a passport. They might even want to know why you're in such a hurry.  Otherwise they might think...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: They might think I was running away from something.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Possibly, Miss.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Good morning. Can I do something for you?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm Miss Mayfield. Is Mr.  Campbell here?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: I'm Mr. Campbell, Miss Mayfield.  Purely as a matter of routine, I want to ask the name of your bank.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Bank?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Merely for our records, Miss Mayfield. It's usual for the guests who come here for the first time.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm carrying quite a large sum in Travelers checks. How much of a deposit would you like?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You can have the table yourself, if you'd rather. I'm only killing time.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, please.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Sit down then. We often have a double up here.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Your liquor laws..

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Disgusting, aren't they? If you really want a Martini, I know where you can get one.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: A fellow named Brandon has a penthouse here. He's holding open house. I was up there. Too noisy. Bored.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: It might be worth a Martini to you.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't need it that badly. I don't enjoy crashing other people's parties.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: It's open-house. No crashing involved. Anybody in the hotel's welcome.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What did you say his name was?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Brandon. Clark Brandon. Fellow about my age. Lot of money... that he didn't make. Former American. Now naturalized in Canada. Social standing indeterminate. Manners not quite perfect. Scotch superb.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You don't sound as if you liked him very much.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: No.. not very well. And I like his friends even less. But..  If you really want a good dry Martini..

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: As I said before...

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Sure. But I'd hate like the Dickens to be held to everything I've said before, wouldn't you?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You're not paying for this. It's quite enough that you let me sit at your table.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I never pay for anything. They just keep me here to amuse the guests.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: And do you amuse the guests?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: No.  Are you really going to drink that stuff?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You're drinking it.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I can be talked out of it. As a matter of fact, I'd like a dry Martini myself.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Would it make you anymore amusing?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Whatever you say.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I didn't say anything.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I don't know you and you don't know me. I made a reasonably polite suggestion. But I'm sure you'd rather be alone.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I hate to be alone. But I've heard all the approaches there are... even yours.
